intro: Nama stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit nama, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by narrow, woody fruits that contain the seeds. Nama stenocarpa is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in regions such as Namibia and South Africa.
